title: How to See Unsent Messages on iPhone: What You Need to Know

steps.title: You can't see unsent messages on iOS 16 or newer.
steps.content: You can't see unsent messages on iOS 16 or newer. However, you may be able to see old messages if you have an old iPhone or iPad running iOS 15 or older. This can also work for Macs running macOS 12 (Monterey) or older. Since it's very unlikely to have an older iOS device, you can try adjusting your notification settings to make sure you don't miss any notifications before they're unsent. To see Messages on other devices, you must have iCloud and iCloud Keychain enabled on both devices. Just open the Messages app on the old device to see unsent messages. Similar to unsent messages on iMessage, you cannot retrieve deleted messages from Facebook Messenger , but you can adjust your notification settings.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. This is the grey cog icon. You can change your notification settings for all apps, including Messages and Facebook Messenger.

steps.title: Tap Notifications.
steps.content: Tap Notifications . This is towards the middle of the page.

steps.title: Tap Messages.
steps.content: Tap Messages . If you want to edit the notifications for Facebook Messenger, tap Messenger . If Allow Notifications isn't already toggled on, tap it to do so now.

steps.title: Set "Banner Style" to "Persistent".
steps.content: Set "Banner Style" to "Persistent". This is underneath the Alerts header. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Set "Show Previews" to "Always".
steps.content: Set "Show Previews" to "Always". This is under the Lock Screen Appearance header. This will ensure notifications will stay on your iPhone. If a message is unsent, you'll still see the first notification containing the unsent text.
